revised_title: Observations of the Solar Eclipse of September 13, 1699
tldr: This article discusses the observations made during the solar eclipse of September 13, 1699, focusing on the methods and findings of various astronomers, including Mr. Wurzelbaur and others. The author shares translated abstracts of their observations and notes the challenges faced in accurately measuring the eclipse's details. The article also touches upon the need for calendar reform and the relationship between celestial mechanics and the motions of the Sun and Moon.
